sense.gloss: to fly (a kite, etc.), to launch (fireworks, etc.), to surface (a submarine, etc.)
to enrol (one's child in school), to enroll
to increase (price, quality, status, etc.), to develop (talent, skill), to improve
to make (a loud sound), to raise (one's voice)
to give (an example, etc.), to cite
to summon up (all of one's energy, etc.)
to offer up (incense, a prayer, etc.) to the gods (or Buddha, etc.)
to conduct (a ceremony, esp. a wedding)
to do for (the sake of someone else)
to rise, to go up, to come up, to ascend, to be raised
to enter (esp. from outdoors), to come in, to go in
to enter (a school), to advance to the next grade
to get out (of water), to come ashore
to occur (esp. of a favourable result)
to be adequate (to cover expenses, etc.)
to be finished, to be done, to be over
to stop (working properly), to cut out, to give out, to die
to win (in a card game, etc.)
to get nervous, to get stage fright
to be offered (to the gods, etc.)
income, takings, earnings, proceeds, (crop) yield, return, profit
end result (e.g. of crafts), how something comes out, finish
finishing (in a board or card game, etc.)
green tea (esp. in a sushi restaurant)
pulling up, drawing up, salvage, re-flotation
launch (of a rocket, satellite, etc.), lift-off, shooting off (fireworks), (fireworks) display
end (of a project, theatrical run, etc.), close, completion
party to celebrate the successful completion of a project (run of performances, etc.), wrap party
aburaage, thin deep-fried slices of tofu
x: 油揚げ・あぶらあげ・1

sense.gloss: to pull up, to drag up, to lift up
to withdraw, to leave, to pull out, to retire
to promote (someone to a higher position)
elevation (of spirits), raising (of morale), uplift, upsurge
after (a long process), at the end of

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓はいつも↑僕↑↓ぼく↓の↑揚↑↓あ↓げ↑足↑↓あし↓を↑取↑↓と↓るね。
sdata.e: You always like to trip me up, don't you?

sdata.j: ワールドカップで↑優勝↑↓ゆうしょう↓した↑全日本↑↓ぜんにほん↓チームは、↑意気揚々↑↓いきようよう↓と↑帰国↑↓きこく↓してきた。
sdata.e: The Japanese World Cup champion team came back home flushed with victory.

sdata.j: ↑凧↑↓たこ↓を↑揚↑↓あ↓げるのは↑危険↑↓きけん↓かもしれない。
sdata.e: Flying a kite can be dangerous.

sdata.j: この↑鶏肉↑↓けいにく↓はよく↑揚↑↓あ↓げられている。
この↑鶏↑↓にわとり↓の↑唐↑↓とう↓↑揚↑↓あ↓げをそのままにしておくのですか。
sdata.e: Are you going to let this fried chicken go begging?

sdata.j: ↑得手↑↓えて↓に↑帆↑↓ほ↓を↑揚↑↓あ↓げる。
sdata.e: Hoist your sail when the wind is fair.

sdata.j: ↑人↑↓ひと↓の↑揚↑↓あ↓げ↑足↑↓あし↓を↑取↑↓と↓るばかりじゃなく、もっと↑建設↑↓けんせつ↓↑的↑↓てき↓な↑意見↑↓いけん↓を↑言↑↓い↓ってくれないかな。
sdata.e: All you ever do is nitpick. I wish you could say something more constructive.

sdata.j: ↑選手↑↓せんしゅ↓↑達↑↓たち↓は↑意気揚々↑↓いきようよう↓と↑競技↑↓きょうぎ↓↑場↑↓じょう↓を↑行進↑↓こうしん↓した。
sdata.e: The players marched triumphantly across the field.

words.gloss: to rise, to go up, to come up, to ascend, to be raised
